content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice contribution. Solved it in about 3 minutes. It's simple and original.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice clash, a bit complicated for a clash, but stil solvable in 5-6 minutes if you've solved similar ones before.
Interesting twist with the fighter's attacks getting stronger as he nears death.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Seems like a good Clash of Code doable in less than 5 minutes
I think the statement is a bit too wordy for CoC

Please follow up the comment from @xerneas02 and also the points below:

Goal
* Please add "in a game" to the end of the first sentence.

Output
* "Current" is unclear in the context, hence please update the wording as follows:

   • "current Ghp" => "remaining hp of Giant".

   • "current Fhp" to "remaining hp of Fighter".

Cases
* Please add a pair of cases where there are many rounds and both are dead at the end:
   • The test should be the same as the example you give in Goal section.
   • The validator should be something similar, e.g.
   4000 1000
   20000 500

* Please add a pair of cases where the Fighter's first attack is normal and second attack is 20x, e.g.
   90210 4250
   7359020 49350
   and
   98890 36900
   144910 53660

* Please add a pair of cases where the Fighter's first attack is 5x and second attack is 20x, e.g.
   58770 97060
   2051380 53770
   and
   87500 65650
   1882690 74030

Thanks.

On the second line, it should be “trying to attack.”
In the example, you wrote “damamge” instead of “damage.”
On the line "The Fighter is dead when HP ≤ 0, but you can still deal damage in the round you’re dead cause…", I think "because" would be better than "cause".
I also think using "The Giant" and "The Fighter" instead of just "Giant" or "Fighter" would read more smoothly.

Otherwise, the problem seems good for Clash of Code and is doable in less than five minutes.

I've modiftied some part of my statement.
Thanks for your comment.

I've modified the parts you mentioned and added some test cases.
I really appreciate your help.
Thanks a lot.

I've changed some part of my statement.
Thanks for commenting.

Title
* Please correct the typo: "comback" => "comeback".

Cases
* Strong Giant (test 9) violates constraint 3 (107060 > 10^5). Please fix the case.

Thanks.

I've changed all of that.
Thank you.
